thread.section_title: Commodities Market News - Yahoo!7 Australia Finance
thread.title: Bonds bullish after Chinese equities slide
thread.title_full: Bonds bullish after Chinese equities slide

title: Bonds bullish after Chinese equities slide
text:
Tue, Jul 28, 2015, 9:16 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 44 mins. Bonds bullish after Chinese equities slide AAP â€“ 20 minutes ago Print 
The Australian bond market has outperformed international markets after China's stockmarket tumble dented global sentiment. 
"There was a pretty risk-off tone to global equity markets, particularly in Europe," JP Morgan interest rate strategist Sally Auld said. 
Both US and European stock markets sagged following sharp falls in China's Shanghai composite index, which suffered the single largest one-day slide in eight years. 
"We did see our (bond) market rally, especially in the 10-year part of the curve," Ms Auld said. 
But, ANZ economists tipped the market to underperform on Tuesday morning. 
At 0830 AEST on Tuesday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.280 (implying a yield of 2.720 per cent), up from 97.215 (2.785 per cent) on Monday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.170 (1.830 per cent), up from 98.140 (1.860 per cent. 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.819%, from 1.819% on Monday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.839%, from 2.839% 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.930 from 97.920 
* December 2015 bill futures, 98.000, from 97.990 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
